alert.note: Alert for Wayne; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 8:36PM CDT until March 27 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Skillet Fork River at Wayne City. .Flooding continues along the Skillet Fork River at Wayne City. The river crested in moderate flood at 17.2 feet and is now falling. The river is forecast to drop below flood stage Monday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skillet Fork River at Wayne City. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly bottomland and surrounding low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Sunday was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Monday morning and continue falling to 7.5 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
